alert.note: Alert for Geary; Riley; Wabaunsee (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 30 at 11:10PM CDT by NWS Topeka
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of central Geary, southeastern Riley, northwestern Wabaunsee and southern Pottawatomie Counties through MIDNIGHT CDT... At 1110 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles northwest of St. George to near Grandview Plaza. Movement was east at 45 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Manhattan, Junction City, Wamego, Alma, Ogden, Grandview Plaza, St. George, McFarland, Belvue, Emmett and Louisville. This includes Interstate 70 between mile markers 293 and 331. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 400 AM CDT for northeastern and east central Kansas.
